natural solution: From the triple angle formula, $\cos 3x = 4 \cos^3 x - 3 \cos x$ and $\sin 3x = 3 \sin x - 4 \sin^3 x.$  Then \[\frac{4 \cos^3 x - 3 \cos x}{\cos x} = 4 \cos^2 x - 3 = \frac{1}{3},\]so $\cos^2 x = \frac{5}{6}.$
Hence, \[\frac{\sin 3x}{\sin x} = \frac{3 \sin x - 4 \sin^3 x}{\sin x} = 3 - 4 \sin^2 x = 3 - 4(1 - \cos^2 x) = \boxed{\frac{7}{3}}.\]

and h2 : "sin x \<noteq> 0"
shows  "sin (3 * x) / sin x = 7 / 3"
